Class HanoiGame

java.lang.Object
  HanoiGame

public class HanoiGame
extends java.lang.Object

A class for representing the Towers of Hanoi game.

Author:
Justin Johnson

Field Summary
static int NUM_PEGS
          The number of pegs in a game of Hanoi is 3.
 
Constructor Summary
HanoiGame(int numDisks)
          Creates a new HanoiGame with a specified number of disks.
HanoiGame(int numDisks, HanoiPanel panel)
          Creates a new HanoiGame with a specified number of disks and which will forward its moves to a specified HanoiPanel for animation.

Field Detail

NUM_PEGS

public static final int NUM_PEGS
The number of pegs in a game of Hanoi is 3.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

HanoiGame

public HanoiGame(int numDisks)
Creates a new HanoiGame with a specified number of disks.

Parameters:
numDisks - The number of disks for this game.

HanoiGame

public HanoiGame(int numDisks,
                 HanoiPanel panel)
Creates a new HanoiGame with a specified number of disks and which will forward its moves to a specified HanoiPanel for animation.

Parameters:
numDisks - The number of disks for this game.
panel - The HanoiPanel that will animate this HanoiGame.
Method Detail

getNumDisks

public int getNumDisks()
Get the number of disks for this HanoiGame.

Returns:
The total number of disks for this game.

getNumDisks

public int getNumDisks(int peg)
Gets the number of disks on a specified peg.

Parameters:
peg - The peg to check. Must have 0 <= peg < NUM_PEGS
Returns:
The number of disks on the specified peg.

isValidMove

public boolean isValidMove(int start,
                           int finish)
Check whether a particular move is valid.

Parameters:
start - The starting peg of the move. Must have 0 <= start < NUM_PEGS.
finish - The ending peg of the move. Must have 0 <= finish < NUM_PEGS.

makeMove

public void makeMove(int start,
                     int finish)
Make a move in this HanoiGame. If the move is not valid then a runtime exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
start - The starting peg of the move.
finish - The ending peg of the move.

isSolved

public boolean isSolved()
Check whether this HanoiGame is solved.

Returns:
true if all the pegs are on the ending peg and false otherwise.

getPeg

public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getPeg(int peg)
Get the contents of one of the pegs.

Parameters:
peg - The peg to inspect. Must have 0 <= peg < NUM_PEGS; if not then a runtime exception is thrown.
Returns:
A List storing the contents of the requested peg. The top of the stack is at index 0. Disks are numbered from 0 to numDisks - 1 and bigger numbers correspond to larger disks.
